instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook A2179  820-01598
threads.message:
Hello, 

This macbook came in today not booting , I plugged my amp amp meter and Device is charging normal pulling 20V 39W and 1.48 Amp  but if press power button , there s no boot , press caps lock key no light and no dim light on screen, I proceeded to open it to run an inspection and found some corrosion around the backlight IC and when I checked for short there was no short, so I cleaned it with a little brush and little bit of  99% alcohol , reinstall board for test still device is charging normal but no boot  no display n no light on Caps lock, I ran some diode mode reading measurements and found PPVCC_SO_CPU  is 0.00 .
Does that mean CPU is dead ?

threads.title: Macbook A2179  820-01598
threads.message: Here s a picture of the corroded area that I found , everywhere else was neat.

threads.title: Macbook A2179  820-01598
threads.message:
Finding corrosion around backlight circuit means always bad news.

CPU coils have low readings as normal.
You should use ohm scale in this case.

Tell us which coils get voltage, apart of CPU ones.

threads.title: Macbook A2179  820-01598
threads.message: I have another board here good working one , and I compare the readings , And Yes the CPU is Partially  shorted,  L7670 5V is present  L7690 3V3 is also there L7030  12V present, all the other coils are 0v

threads.title: Macbook A2179  820-01598
threads.message:
Post exact ohm resistance to ground on CPU coils for both boards.
If you get big difference, CPU is dead.

threads.title: Macbook A2179  820-01598
threads.message: To me CPU is dead  or  it needs reballing.

threads.title: Macbook A2179  820-01598
threads.message:
Reball a dead chip; how can help?
Dead you hear about massage of a wood foot?
